snippet: Rabbis and church leaders in the Rockaways section of Queens and along the Jersey Shore have relied on their congregations and outside volunteers to try to restore what the storm damaged.
abstract: Leaders at dozens of houses of worship across the region affected by Hurricane Sandy are in an extraordinary and emotionally difficult situation; instead of being able to focus on the urgent mission of feeding and caring for congregants hurt by the storm, many clergy members are being forced to ask for help for themselves as they face the reality of damaged or destroyed churches and synagogues.
lead_paragraph: Rabbis and church leaders in the Rockaways section of Queens and along the Jersey Shore have relied on their congregations and outside volunteers to try to restore what the storm damaged.

headline.seo: Regional Places of Worship Seek to Rebuild
headline.main: For Congregation Leaders, Hurricane Is Taking a Toll
headline.print_headline: For Congregation Leaders, Hurricane Is Taking a Toll
